table.name: btl
table.label: BTL
table.description: This table stores a reference to the file which stores the Basic Transmission Loss. This is the loss before any antenna information (gain and pattern) or any transmitted power and system losses are taken into account. It is re-used to speed up subsequent prediction with the same parameters

field.name: id
field.type: serial primary key unique not null
field.label: ID
field.description: Primary key

field.name: lastmodified
field.label: Last modified
field.description: The time when this entry was last modified. This field is used during synchronisation of different machines / copies of the database

field.name: machineid
field.label: MachineID
field.description: QRap Installation/Machine ID. This is used to identify from which machine this entry originated when the system is synchronised

field.name: siteid
field.type: integer references site(id) on delete cascade
field.label: Site ID
field.description: Foreign Key to the site table. Reference the site for which the Basic Transmission Loss calculations are valid

field.name: dtmsource
field.label: DTM source file
field.description: Foreign Key to the file-set table. Reference the Digital Elevation Model file set used during the Basic Transmission Loss calculations

field.name: cluttersource
field.label: Clutter source file
field.description: Foreign Key to the file-set table. Reference the Clutter file set used during the Basic Transmission Loss calculations

field.name: antennaheight
field.label: Antenna height
field.description: The height of the antenna during the Basic Transmission Loss calculations

field.name: mobileheight
field.label: Mobile height
field.description: The height of the roaming/mobile antenna during the Basic Transmission Loss calculations

field.name: frequency
field.description: The frequency for which the during the Basic Transmission Loss calculations was done.
field.label: Frequency

field.name: kfactor
field.description: The k-Factor for which the during the Basic Transmission Loss calculations was done. Indication of the refractivity of the lower air. The k-Factor is used to determine the effective earth radius. Effective Earth Radius is the Real Earth Radius multiplied by the k-factor
field.label: k-Factor

field.name: radius
field.label: Radius
field.description: The furthest distance to which the calculations were done.

field.name: numangles
field.description: The number of radii for which the calculations were done. Angular Resolution = 360 / numangles.
field.label: Number of intervals in 360 degrees

field.name: distanceres
field.label: Distance resolution
field.description: The interval at which calculations are done in meters.

field.name: btlplot
field.label: BTL plot file-name
field.description: The name of the file where the Basic Transmission Loss calculations are stored.

field.name: maxr
field.label: MaxR
field.description: The distance for which the calculation was requested. It will be bigger or equal to the Radius.

field.name: downlink

field.name: fademargin

view.name: antenna_view
view.as:
select antenna.id as id, site.sitename as sitename, antenna.serialnumber as serialnumber, antenna.rikey as rikey, antenna.antdevicekey as antdevicekey, antenna.installationdate as installationdate from antenna, radioinstallation, site where (antenna.rikey=radioinstallation.id and radioinstallation.siteid=site.id )
union
select antenna.id as id, null as sitename, antenna.serialnumber as serialnumber, antenna.rikey as rikey, antenna.antdevicekey as antdevicekey, antenna.installationdate as installationdate from antenna where antenna.rikey is null

table.name: cell
table.label: Cell
table.description: A Cell is a logical entity typically representing traffic carried via a radio installation.

field.name: id
field.type: serial primary key unique not null
field.label: ID
field.description: Primary key

field.name: lastmodified
field.label: Last modified
field.description: The time when this entry was last modified. This field is used during synchronisation of different machines / copies of the database

field.name: machineid
field.label: MachineID
field.description: QRap Installation/Machine ID. This is used to identify from which machine this entry originated when the system is synchronised

field.name: mastercell
field.type: integer references cell(id) on delete cascade
field.label: Master cell
field.description: Normally NULL. In a overlay-underlay cell structure this will be the reference from the overlaying cell to the under-laying cell.

field.name: risector
field.type: integer references radioinstallation(id) on delete cascade
field.label: Radio Installation
field.description: The Radio Installation on which this cell is implemented.

field.name: cstraffic
field.description: Circuit Switched traffic measured in Erlang that is carried on this cell
field.label: CS traffic

field.name: pstraffic
field.description: Packet Switched traffic measured in MegaByte per second that is carried on this cell
field.label: PS traffic

field.name: txpower
field.label: Transmitter power
field.description: Transmitter power as can be altered via software.

field.name: beacon
field.description: The unique cell identifier e.g. BSIC for GSM or CPICH for UMTS
field.label: Beacon

field.name: centriod
field.label: Location Centre of Cell Coverage
field.description: This is the assumed centre of the cell coverage.

view.name: cell_view
view.as: select cell.id as id, sitename||sector as sectorname, cell.id||sitename||sector as cellname, cell.risector as risector, cell.mastercell as mastercell, cell.permanent as permanent, cell.cstraffic as cstraffic, cell.pstraffic as pstraffic, cell.txpower as txpower, cell.beacon as beacon, cell.layerthreshold as layerthreshold from site, radioinstallation, cell where (cell.risector = radioinstallation.id and radioinstallation.siteid = site.id)

table.label: Links
table.desription: The link table provides information of all existing links between two Radio Installations

field.name: id
field.type: serial primary key unique not null
field.label: ID
field.description: Primary key

field.name: lastmodified
field.label: Last modified
field.description: The time when this entry was last modified. This field is used during synchronisation of different machines / copies of the database

field.label: MachineID
field.description: QRap Installation/Machine ID. This is used to identify from which machine this entry originated when the system is synchronised

field.description: A short desriptive identifier for the link
field.label: Link Name

field.name: txinst
field.type: integer references radioinstallation(id) on delete cascade
field.description: Foreign Key reference to the Radio Installation table to the Transmitting Installation
field.label: Tx Installation

field.name: rxinst
field.type: integer references radioinstallation(id) on delete cascade
field.description: Foreign Key reference to the Radio Installation table to the Receiving Installation
field.label: Rx Installation

field.name: minclearance
field.label: Minimum Clearance
field.description: The minimum clearance along the path.

field.name: frequency
field.label: Frequency
field.description: The frequency at which the calculations were done.

field.name: pathloss
field.description: The path loss experienced along the path. It is reciprocal, i.e. the same for both directions.
field.label: Pathloss

field.name: kfactor
field.label: k-factor
field.description: Indication of the refractivity of the lower air. The k-Factor is used to determine the effective earth radius. Effective Earth Radius is the Real Earth Radius multiplied by the k-factor

field.name: line
field.label: Line
field.description: The geographical line that is used to display the link visually.

view.name: links_view
view.as: select links.id as id, linkname, site1.sitename||rad1.sector as txsite, txinst, rad1.txbearing as txbearing, site2.sitename||rad2.sector as rxsite, rxinst, rad2.txbearing as txbearing, ST_Distance(site1.location, site2.location, true) as Distance, minclearance, frequency, pathloss, kfactor, line, status from links cross join radioinstallation as rad1 cross join site_view_only as site1 cross join radioinstallation as rad2 cross join site_view_only as site2 where rad1.id=txinst and rxinst=rad2.id and rad1.siteid=site1.id and rad2.siteid=site2.id;
